INFORMATION & COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGY

Primary purpose of job

The Technician Telecommunications Services is to conduct, manage, and supervise implementation, operational and

maintenance requirements of Telephony and Services related telecommunication systems infrastructure and maintaining a

24X7 availability and delivery of telecommunication related applications and services across the corporation. The

incumbent will also have direct first level role in operation, management and technical support of related systems.

Experience & Skills

Preferably technical training certifications in one or more areas of following technologies: Telephony, Radio Systems,
SDH/DWDM, PAGA, CCTV, ACS and AV.

Excellent knowledge in the area of structured cabling installation, termination, commissioning, and troubleshooting.
Basic technical knowledge of telecommunication infrastructure core technologies, experience with telecommunication
infrastructure hardware installations and configurations, knowledge of IP convergence systems and services, PTT-grade

telecommunication systems, Radio and Satellite implementation and services, emerging infrastructure services, and

general industrial-grade telecommunication technologies and systems.

Advanced technical knowledge and experience in configuration and use of specialized telecommunication test sets and
related applications for verification or troubleshooting of telecommunication infrastructure.

Technical understanding of service providers’ technologies and integration of telecommunication products and services.
Strong personal computer office applications, verbal and communications skills.
Technical hands-on knowledge and experience in implementation and operation of systems related to following
technologies: PABX Telephony, SDH/PDH, DWDM, Microwave, Passive Infrastructure (Copper and Fibre cabling), Fibre

Optics cables monitoring and NMS (Network Management System) and related systems.

Technical knowledge and understanding of Telephony, SDH/PDH, DWDM, Microwave, Audio Visual system, Fibre Optics
cables monitoring and NMS, solutions and related protocols, and solutions.

Technical knowledge in video and CCTV systems, TCP/IP suite, SCADA, PAGA, and industrial telecommunications
systems.

Support optimization and efficient use of resources across the department to improve delivery of telecommunication
services.

Ability to operate and complete assigned tasks on schedule across multiple diverse projects with common or unique
ICT/telecommunication service requirements.

Ability to collect, analyse and report relevant detailed telecommunication equipment technical logs, and data in reference
to reported incidents.

Apply technical solutions to resolve operational issues and incidents based on technical recommended procedures in a
timely manner.

Apply assigned technical recommendations and procedures as preventive or corrective measures for a 24X7 sustained
fault-free operation and update of telecommunication systems and infrastructure.

Regular interface with division engineers and peers for ensuring alignment of projects objectives, proper execution of
assigned tasks and objectives on schedule.

Regular contact with various QP Departments and technical staff to ensure compliance and alignment of assigned tasks
and projects with defined deliverables under overall division objectives.

Intermittent contact with QP subsidiaries, affiliates technical focal points related to provisioning of new services or
operational requirements.

Intermittent contact with internal and external auditors at request of supervisor to ensure transparency and enforce
compliance with corporate policies and international standards.

Frequent contact with external service provider(s) to commission requested telecommunication infrastructure or resolve
issues related to ICT/telecommunication services.

Education

Technical Diploma and 5 years of technical experience in the field of telecommunications, preferably related to Offshore Oil

and Gas industry.

The Petroleum Data Analyst will be primarily responsible for delivering and supporting lifecycle information management of

geological, geophysical, petrophysical, petroleum engineering, and reservoir engineering physical and digital data for

upstream disciplines in SD & E Departments. The position will coordinate with Lead Petroleum Data Analyst on all

technical data management activities including workflows, validation, and QC of incoming data for SD & E Corporate,

Master and Project databases of geoscience and petroleum engineering data. Coordinate the design, development,

implementation and maintenance of the SD & E upstream data management system for physical and digital data assets.

Experience & Skills

Multidiscipline experience (petroleum engineering, geoscience, GIS, computer science) across disciplines.
Broad knowledge of subsurface data types (e.g. logs, well testing, coring, down-hole sampling) and surface data
acquisition (e.g. surface production metering, sampling).

Good knowledge of data management and related software and databases for geoscience and petroleum engineering
(e.g. Petrel, eSearch, ProSource, OpenWorks, Studio, UNIX).

Broad knowledge of geoscience and petroleum engineering data handling (loading, manipulation, editing, access,
integration, federation and architecture).

Some knowledge of the interpretation/analysis environment of the geoscientists and petroleum engineers.
Good knowledge of database management systems and petroleum industry data modelling concepts & script writing.
Good client and vendor relationship management skills.
Excellent supervision, team building and procedure skills.
Good communication, presentation and motivation skills.
10+ years’ experience in the petroleum industry with 5+ years’ experience in the handling geoscience and petroleum
engineering data.

Education

B.Sc. in Information Management or Computer science or Geoscience

Job Summary:
Document Controller is responsible to ensure the Document Management consistency across all Projects, meticulously, maintaining control and traceability of the documentation from Project initiation throughout completion.
Duties & Responsibilities, (include but not limited to):
- Implement and maintain document control processes and procedures.
- Develop and maintain the Document Management System.
- Manage all flows of documents either in electronic form or on paper support.
- Ensure Document Management accordingly to established procedures or standards (documents numbering, formats, issuance, review, dispatch, recording and archiving)
- Adjusting document number formats as per client’s documentation standards/EGEC policy.
- Basic quality checks (Ensuring proper revision history including revision notification in drawings/documents, spelling & grammatical checks).
- Proper formatting/adjusting of all documents as per client’s standards/EGEC policy.
- Process incoming documentation (registration in the DMS, internal distribution, archiving).
- Process outgoing documentation (transmit to Client and Suppliers/3rd parties).
- Makes sure that controlled copies of latest approved documents and drawings are distributed internally and externally (Clients and Suppliers).
- Ensure control and coordination of projects documentation and data.
- Ensure all drawings/documentation are correctly identified, distributed and filed/stored.
- General document control activities such as photocopying, scanning, analysis of supplier’s documents compliance with Project standards regarding numbering and all others aspect related to document quality.
- Assistance in the preparation collation and issue of reports and registers as may be required.
- Communicate and liaise with Project Teams, Suppliers/3rd parties to agree standards, systems, efficient flow of documentation, handover and close-out of Project activity to ensure consistency in document control as required.
- Monitor technical documents review and approval in accordance with agreed schedule
- Monitoring of documentation progress in cooperation with the project planner
- Produce internal and external (Clients and Suppliers) over-due reports.
- Ensuring the use of standardized forms and templates.
- Set-up Projects folders and facilitate Project communication process.
- Establish and maintain the Master Document Register in cooperation with the Project Manager or Lead as it is confidential.
- Other relevant duties/tasks as directed by Project Manager/Lead.
- In all the above document related responsibilities have to follow clients & EGEC’s QHSE standards.
- Provide the support and cooperation in regards to the Quality department requirements and Audits.
- Provide the support and cooperation in regards to the Business development & tenders management activities when requested.
Education & Experience:
- Bachelor’s Degree in Business management or relevant degree
- 4-8 years of experience
- Fluent in English
- Locally based candidates
- Can Join Immediately
Job Type: Full-time
Application Question(s):
Will you be able to join immediately ?
What is your current salary ?
What is your expected salary ?

Bachelor's (Preferred)

What can MEEZA offer you?
MEEZA is committed to providing thought leadership that will enable our employees to be involved in bringing global firsts to the market.
MEEZA is one of the fastest growing technology companies in the Middle East which means an exciting and rewarding work environment for our employees.
MEEZA is playing a key role in the transformation of Qatar into a knowledge-based society which means our employees can make a real impact.
MEEZA is committed to developing our team; we provide opportunities to develop your skills, further your career and achieve your goals.
MEEZA is not just about hard work; the company remains true to its entrepreneurial roots and has a young and passionate team that is just as devoted to having fun as they are to delivering service excellence.
MEEZA offers market-leading benefits packages.

The Role
JOIN US IN POWERING CHANGE
We are looking for graduates who share our purpose to power progress and our culture of inclusion, collaboration, and care. We’ll give you the support you need to forge your own path, and you’ll have real responsibilities and meaningful projects to work on right from the start.

WHERE YOU FIT IN
Shell’s purpose is to power progress together, by providing more and cleaner energy solutions. We believe that rising standards of living for a growing global population are likely to continue to drive demand for energy, including oil and gas, for years to come. At the same time, technology changes and the need to tackle climate change means there is a transition underway to a lower-carbon, multi-source energy system.

As one of the world’s leading energy companies, Shell plays a key role in meeting the world’s growing energy demand in economically, environmentally, and socially responsible ways. There has never been a more exciting time to be part of the energy industry. Join us in our ambition to be a net-zero emissions energy business by 2050, and sooner if that is possible.

Qatar Shell is one of the largest foreign investors in Qatar, with Pearl GTL being the world’s largest GTL plant. Joining our graduate program will drive you to work on some of the world’s most innovative energy projects in a dynamic environment.

WHAT’S THE ROLE?
Our Graduate Programme is a rigorous development framework of specific competences, business-critical capabilities, and critical experiences that will enable you to become a competitive professional by the end of your 3-year programme.

Right from the start, you will be given a challenging hands-on role, working in a diverse, global environment. You will be supervised and mentored with frequent reviews as part of a structured development programme. You will also be learning alongside brilliant people from all over the world, with the resources and support to explore new ways of thinking and working – all in all, an unbeatable experience.

We know that learning is key to developing yourself both personally and professionally. The graduate programme encompasses a learning framework that includes internal and external courses designed to help you gain the skills you need to succeed.

We are looking for ambitious Qatari Mechanical Engineering Graduates with a bachelor’s degree or experience of less than three years to help us #MakeTheFuture.

Above all else, you should enjoy being challenged, rather than being overwhelmed, if a task seems impossible. You welcome the opportunity to be innovative. You also need to be good at absorbing information, creative, analysing problems, and making objective decisions. You should have the drive, confidence and resilience to get things done, the flexibility to work in a team and the credibility to influence others.

WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU
You should enjoy being challenged, so that rather than being daunted or overwhelmed if a task seems impossible, you welcome the opportunity to be innovative. You also need to be good at absorbing information, analysing problems, making objective decisions, and coming up with original ideas. You should have the drive, confidence, and resilience to get things done, the flexibility to work well as part of a team and the credibility to influence others.

About Us
Kimpton Hotels & Restaurants is the original boutique hotel company, which pioneered the concept of unique, distinctive, design-forward hotels in SanFrancisco, California before expanding worldwide. Anchored in one-of-a-kind experiences, Kimpton spaces and experiences center on our guests, offering an inspiring design that evokes curiosity to forward-thinking flavors that feed the soul. Every detail is thoughtfully curated and artfully delivered, so that guest experiences remain meaningful, unscripted, and ridiculously personal. Our mission is to be the best-loved hotel and Restaurant Company through the common belief that heartfelt connections make people’s lives better. Our colleagues are empowered and encouraged to act from the heart, to go above and beyond to create ‘ridiculously personal’ experiences for each other and our guests. We're looking for passionate, high-spirited individuals to join the pre-opening team at Kimpton Doha, the very first Kimpton hotel in the Middle East. The ideal Kimpton team member has an inclusive spirit who embraces individuality and can cultivate a work environment that’s a bit quirky, irreverent, exciting, uncommon, empowering, and downright exceptional. Our hotel is only as good as the people it employs so if you’re passionate, focused and driven, live for making every guest’s experience ‘ridiculously personal’ and creating unforgettable moments, then we invite you to join the Kimpton tribe. Located in the heart of Doha Old Town, Kimpton Al Rowda Doha will be the first Kimpton in the Middle East bringing the brand’s playful energy, infectious personality, and unique design style to this charming and vibrant area of town. Just a stone’s throw from the many favorite sights of the Qatari capital, the hotel will welcome guests and locals to experience its 283 guest rooms, including suites and serviced apartments, and to enjoy a multitude of unique dining options.



Your day to day
IT Assistant jobs involve providing technical support related to both hardware and software. This requires expertise in computer networks and often certification through specific software or hardware vendors. IT Assistants can work in a range of different fields as most businesses require constant IT support. IT Assistants have many responsibilities and daily duties. They provide constant administration support including answering and transferring calls, proofreading, data entry, and operating essential machineries such as printers and copiers. They also need to resolve customer problems on a daily basis both accurately and in a timely manner. As well as providing technical assistance, IT assistants often prepare and maintain documents, particularly for company policies and procedures. Data is also an important part of an IT Assistant’s daily duties. IT assistants back up data and control access to this. They also install new hardware or software to keep an organization’s data storage and communication up to date. Important maintenance is also a key part of an information technology assistant’s role. They frequently have to troubleshoot and fix hardware or software issues. Some IT assistants specialize in the maintenance of particular hardware or software. Along with repairs, IT assistants often inventory computer goods and necessities. One of the main roles of an information technology assistant is user assistance. Many businesses use specific software, email programs, and other specialized systems. IT assistants are responsible for training staff on how to use these. They may also include creating user manuals. No matter how simple or complicated the task, IT Assistants provide user assistance on a daily basis.



What we need from you
• Computer network skills • Peripheral skills • Attention to details • Good communication skills • Luxury and lifestyle experience is preferred • Pre-Opening experience is an advantage



What we offer
We’ll reward all your hard work with competitive salary and benefits. Join us and you’ll become part of the global IHG family – and like all families, all our individual team members share some winning characteristics. As a team, we work better together – we trust and support each other, we do the right thing and we welcome different perspectives. You need to show us you care: that you notice the little things that make a difference to guests as well as always looking for ways to improve - visit www.careers.ihg.com to find out more about us. So go on - show us how your passion and personality are the perfect fit to deliver memorable experiences to our guests.
Don't quite meet every single requirement, but still believe you'd be a great fit for the job? We'll never know unless you hit the 'Apply' button. Start your journey with us today and let's #GoFurtherTogether.

Employer: Phi Med
Position: Laboratory Technologist
Start date: As soon as possible
About Us
PHI Med is a Qatar-based Medical Services Agency that aims to develop the medical industry in the country by providing optimal solutions for business development and by offering medical assistance to healthcare facilities. Specialized in plastic surgery and dermatology, we are currently undergoing a huge expansion. A new branch is targeted to be open soon, which means big opportunities for healthcare professionals looking to work in Qatar.
Interesting fact: “PHI” comes from the 21st letter of the ancient Greek alphabet. In the aesthetic industry, the Phi letter is also attributed to the perfect symmetry or so-called “golden ratio” of a face. This has been the branding of the Phi Group. We are committed to redefining perfection, not only by physical attributes but with everything that we do.
Job Overview
The Laboratory Technologist is responsible for undertaking a variety of technical laboratory procedures. The main responsibilities including analyzing samples, conducting tests and reporting results.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Collecting, labeling, and analyzing samples using the correct testing equipment.
Designing and performing laboratory testing according to the standard testing procedures.
Recording all experimental data and test results accurately.
Organizing and storing all chemical substances, fluids, and compressed gases according to safety instructions.
Ensuring that safety guidelines are adhered to at all times within the laboratory.
Maintaining daily logs and equipment record books.
Cleaning, sterilizing, maintaining, and calibrating laboratory equipment.
Ordering laboratory supplies.
Providing technical support.
Keeping up to date with relevant scientific and technical developments.
Adopting safe work habits, including complying with all safety, health, and environmental rules and regulations in the State of Qatar.
Qualifications:
Must have a Bachelor of Science in Medical Technology
Must have a QCHP license as a Laboratory Technologist
Must have a minimum of 3 years of total experience
Strong analytical and numerical skills
Keen eye for detail
Excellent physical condition and endurance
Comfortable handling potentially dangerous substances
Ability to work autonomously and under pressure
Benefits
By joining our company, you will be welcomed into a collaborative and friendly environment. We place great emphasis on employee satisfaction and have a dedicated HR team to attend to your every need.
If this sounds like a job that would interest you, then we would love to hear from you. Please click on “apply” and a member from the HR department will be in contact with you.
Short-listed candidates will be contacted for an interview.

About the Role
We are looking for an experienced, thorough, and insightful Inventory Controller to manage the inventory for our company. In this role, you will be required to coordinate orders and deliveries, perform regular inventory audits and analyses, and forecast the supply and demand requirements to ensure consistent stock levels. To ensure success as an inventory controller, you should be highly organized and have detailed knowledge of supply chain management software and practices. A top-notch inventory controller will be able to accurately forecast inventory requirements and possess excellent logistical abilities.
Main Responsibilities
Monitoring inventory levels and replenishing stock as needed.
Developing and implementing inventory control systems and practices.
Liaising and negotiating with vendors and suppliers to ensure the quality of stock purchases.
Coordinating the logistics of purchase orders, stock transfers, deliveries, tagging, and processing.
Forecasting supply and demand requirements to ensure stock availability.
Tracking inbound and outbound orders to prevent overstocking and out-of-stock (OOS).
Analyzing and reviewing supply chain data to identify and resolve issues.
Generating purchase and pricing reports, supply chain analysis, and inventory management systems.
Performing regular stock checks and reporting any issues to the supervisor.
Maintaining and updating records of purchase orders, pricing reports, and inventory records.
Inventory costing.
Skills & Experience
BS degree in logistics, business administration or similar field preferred
A minimum of 5 years of experience in FMCG retail, warehousing, logistics, or similar.
With experience using Odoo15 and other inventory software.
Exceptional understanding of inventory management practices such as ABC analysis and cycle counting.
Good analytical and logistical thinking abilities.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Exceptional collaboration and negotiation abilities.
Excellent time management and organizational skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office

Data Scientist
At Freedom Finance we help customers navigate borrowing through our digital marketplace. At the heart of this, we’ve developed a modern technology finance platform built to connect customers with lenders via a seamless digital experience.
So, what’s next for us? Well it’s our ambition is to keep extending our product range so we can provide customers with the widest choice, delivering value to customers, partners, and lenders. We’re not just a B2C platform. We also offer embedded finance to our B2B partners, allowing them to broaden their current product offering and help more customers than ever before.
We’re looking for an entrepreneurial Data Scientist to help us take our business one step further. The next phase of our evolution aims to use our vast amounts of data to develop new services that help customers save money and access the best available products. We are at the forefront of the Open Banking data evolution. Now, we need to someone who can help us accelerate our growth by using our data to enhance our capabilities.
What can we offer you?
Competitive salary with market benchmark
Bonus scheme based on personal and company performance
33 days holiday (includes bank holidays)
4% pension contribution & pension advice
Health cash plan (plus free balance for dependants up to the age of 16)
2 x Life Assurance
Enhanced Maternity/Adoption/Paternity Pay
Enhanced sick pay
Car Scheme (after 1 years’ service)
Income Protection
2 x days holiday buy/sell
Voucher/Tech scheme
Cycle-to-work scheme
Birthday takeaway voucher
Benefits portal with access to a wide range of retailer discounts
What will you be doing?
As a Data Scientist, you'll extract, analyse, and interpret large amounts of data from a range of sources, using algorithmic, data mining, artificial intelligence, machine learning and statistical tools to make it accessible. Once you've interpreted the data, you'll present your results using clear and engaging language.
You’ll be working on the data products initiative, designing and building new products and services for our customer base. You‘ll be working towards two prime objectives:
Helping customers save money and improve their creditworthiness
Developing data-driven capabilities to automate our intelligence
You’ll be joining a new capability within the business so you will have the opportunity to make a major impact.
Who we are looking for
You'll be expected to bridge a multi-disciplined domain of the business, data and software with a natural consultancy style to understand problems and devise solutions. Demonstrating exceptional communication and presentation skills to explain your work to people who don't understand the mechanics behind data analysis.
You’ll have the drive and the resilience to try new ideas, and keep going in the face of adversity, so it's important that you're able to motivate yourself. As part of the interview process, we’ll be interested in your experience across the following disciplines:
Probability and statistics
Multivariate calculus and linear algebra
Programming, packages and software such as R, Python and SQL
Data wrangling
Database management
Data visualisation
Machine learning / deep learning
The technology
Our platform is composed of leading modern software technologies deployed within the cloud. This was custom built from scratch and allows us to move fast with high quality and low risk. We strive for new and innovative ways to achieve outcomes, and you’ll have the opportunity to make use of technologies that can accelerate or differentiate our capabilities.
Our team
We like to create cross-functional teams working together on shared objectives. You’ll be joining a newly formed capability composed of data scientists, BI developers, and data engineers, and together you’ll work with commercial, marketing and engineering teams to create innovative products and services.
Our main office is based in Manchester, but we have a flexible work-from-home policy and can consider fully remote positions for the right candidate. It’s nice to catch up in person now and again so the ideal candidate should be open to this.
The interview process
We try to keep our interview process as simple and efficient as possible so that we can both make a timely decision about whether we align with each other’s interests and goals.
We have a fast and effective three-stage interview process. Stage one is a short phone screen, while stages two and three are both face-to-face interviews (using MS Teams or in-person). This allows candidates to meet with the hiring manager, and other team members.
We know that it can be challenging to interview while being employed, so we try to be flexible on interview times.
Interested? Then we’d love to hear from you. If this sounds like the right career move, apply for our Data Scientist role using the apply now link.

Main Responsibilities
As a Data Scientist, your role will involve speaking to stakeholders to evaluate requirements for data science projects, preparing data and evaluating modelling approaches, developing machine learning models and collaborating with engineers in deploying and maintaining them. Previous data science experience is desirable but not essential; we are more interested in your willingness and ability to learn, communication skills and ability to take initiative and work effectively in a team.
You will work in cross-functional teams alongside Product, Editorial, Software/Data Engineers and other Data Scientists. We value learning and create a supportive environment for people to follow their interests and develop personally and professionally, through structured training and on-the-job experience.
You'll be joining at an exciting time, as the BBC becomes digital-first and places more emphasis on its online products than ever before. Our team will be crucial in this process and the projects you work on will have an enormous impact, such as using ML to make our content creation more data-driven, or building audience-facing recommendations that enrich the experience of millions of people.
Are you the right candidate?
This is what you'll need to be successful in this role:
Demonstrable interest in data science and a keen enthusiasm for learning
Experience working on technical projects involving coding, preferably as part of a team
Typically holds an advanced degree in mathematics, statistics or computer science or related field, or equivalent experience
Good communication and interpersonal skills
Demonstrable ability to quickly understand new concepts and think of original solutions to novel problems
Knowledge of one or more business/functional areas
It would be great if you also had the following skills/experience:
Statistical modelling and analysis experience in either Python or R
Experience in the use of statistical packages and machine learning algorithms
Interest in the public service mission of the BBC
Broadcast, production, start-up or media experience
A mix of public sector and commercial experience
Successful academic background in your specialist discipline
The interview process for this role will be:
2md stage - 1h 30 min video call where we'll ask you to present on past project or piece of work. We'll also ask questions on technical competency, cultural fit and leave plenty of time for your questions too!

The role
As the Data Scientist Trainee for Wandsworth and Richmond Councils you will learn how to scope, manage, and deliver data science projects, be part of the delivery of our data and analytics strategy and action plan, and contribute towards advancing Richmond and Wandsworth Councils’ data maturity.
You will have the unique opportunity to see the positive impact your work has on residents’ lives.
Note: This post is restricted to only those who are required to complete 6-12 month work placement as a requirement to graduate from an advance data science degree, such as a MSc in Data Science.
This is a fixed term post for up to 12 months.
About the team
The role will be based within the corporate Insight and Analytics Team, which includes data scientists, intelligence analysts, analyst support officers and a data projects officer.
We are a very supportive and collaborative team. Our management are also strongly behind us in advancing data and analytics.
Ideal candidate:
Keen to learn and develop their data science skills
Inquisitive and able to understand the business need for data analysis and products
Able to explain data concepts to lay audiences
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Coding skills R or Python and able to query data using SQL
Experience of working in cloud environment (desirable)
Previous experience working in a data science or IT team. This could have been as a job or work experience placement. (Desirable)

Flexible Working
At Richmond and Wandsworth Councils, we care more about how you work and what you achieve, rather than where you work on any given day. The difference you can make to our local communities is what really matters most to us, service delivery must always come first. We have carefully considered agile ways of working to provide the best experience for residents, stakeholders and our staff. Our agile working strategy actively supports and encourages a dynamic work environment and daily working experience. Agile working helps put the needs of our staff at the centre of everything we do, so if specific flexible working arrangements helps you with this, feel free to let us know.
Your wellbeing and the flexible way in which you can work is and will remain a key priority for Richmond and Wandsworth Councils. We want you to thrive and feel empowered in your work!
Benefits
We recognise the importance of a good balance between work and home life so we do everything we can to accommodate flexible working including, working from home, compressed or part-time hours, term time only, job shares and other arrangements. Please just let us know in your application or at any stage throughout the process (and beyond) if these are options you’d like to explore.
We also offer a generous holiday allowance of 31 paid days (pro rata) plus bank holidays and a wide range of learning and development opportunities. In addition, we offer a comprehensive range of staff benefits such as membership of the Local Government pension scheme, childcare vouchers, new technology scheme, interest-free loans on annual travel cards, discounts with many leisure activities, restaurants, shops and other establishments.
Equality Statement
We particularly welcome applications from sections of the community who are currently underrepresented within our teams, including BAME and local residents.
Richmond and Wandsworth Councils are committed to making our recruitment practices as inclusive as possible for everyone. We are committed to promoting equality and diversity and developing a culture that values differences, recognising that employees from a variety of backgrounds bring important and positive contributions to the Councils and can improve the way we deliver services. We are proud to be a Disability Confident employer.
Important Information
Richmond and Wandsworth Councils are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people/vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.

Start ups grow quick, and the best start ups remain agile. At some point, these start ups need to stop, take stock, and have a tidy up ready for the next part of the journey.
And it is at this point that we want you at a very particular part of your journey!
Internships are quite the common thing out in the tech world, so why would you want to take this one?
Well, the project we are looking to assign an intern to is helping us compile a fresh new data map from start to finish. You'll be trained and even certified as trained on the platform by the partner that we are going to be using for the endeavour, and by the end of your time with us, you will understand in an incredibly in depth way how the 'data factory' that powers our product is set up, and how it works.
If you are looking at a career in Data Science, or Data Analytics, this is THE internship for you. You will get support and guidance from experienced data professionals all while genuinely experiencing owning a project. You'll have access to stakeholders in all areas of the business, and will be supported by the Data, Tech and Compliance teams in your endeavours.
What will you be doing?
Working with our chosen partner and platform, you will be mapping from scratch the Selina Data map.
This will involve:
Reviewing our current map
Starting the process a fresh using the chosen platform
Attending and passing the certified training given by the chosen provider
Investigating all data fields and data bases used in our overall operation, and using the chosen platform to map everything
Investigating what data is taken, and stored, where, and why, for pretty much everything
Working with the Data team to evolve from newbie to data knowledge pro
Working with the compliance team to deliver a best in class data map at the end of the project
What about you, what do you need to bring/have?
An inquisitive, and curios mindset
The ability to ask effective questions
The ability to ask questions of busy stakeholders in a way that engenders collaboration
A comfort around technology and data as a concept
A proven ability to manage a workload and deliver to deadlines on a project
Effective written and verbal communication skills
Things that would be nice for you to have (please do not let any of these points prevent you from applying):
A degree (in progress) in the data, technology or theoretical sciences fields
Previous experience and knowledge of data and insughts within a commercial environment
What we offer:
£22,000 base salary (pro rata for the 6 month length of the internship)
25 days annual holiday
Annual l&d budget
Cycle to work scheme
3% pension contribution
Monthly socials
Free access to mental health support via Spill
A choice of benefits that work for you courtesy of our benefits platform, Thanks Ben ️ ❤️‍
Annual £60 cycle allowance for santander cycles or Evans (via Thanks Ben)

About the role
We have an exciting opportunity to join our digital marketing department as an Analyst. In this role, you’ll be responsible for driving the insight agenda and informing commercial decisions from complex data from multiple sources and databases, playing a key role in meeting the requirements of the insight schedule and delivering against the Club’s strategic priorities by providing visual and actionable customer insight. You’ll aid the digital marketing campaign process assisting the wider Marketing team to segment and target LFC audiences whilst tracking results and helping to increase ROAS.
What will you be doing?
Query LFC’s fan data from multiple data sources – including the Club’s marketing data warehouse, web & app analytics, social analytics, web benchmarking tools, the Club’s mobile apps, TV channel (LFCTV) and more – utilising SQL, Excel and other analytical tools whilst calling on various techniques to provide trends and behavioural insight for business units across the organisation as required
Interrogate and analyse data to produce valuable, clear and concise findings and recommendations which can be used to inform commercial decisions and be translated into tangible actions
Deliver easy-to-consume fan & customer insight reports and data visualisations within the Digital department and to the business overall, focussing on delivering insight that can aid the Club’s strategic priorities, adding commentary that is relevant and actionable
Regularly update trackers, visual dashboards, stats reports, etc. keeping a track of the Club’s digital performance as well as its main competitors’. Track performance against digital KPIs
Develop and maintain a good working relationship with senior leaders and commercial teams to communicate key results on a regular basis presenting to stakeholders on behalf of the Marketing Insight team where required to demonstrate the potential impacts on the business
Stay on top of the Marketing Insight team’s inbox issuing ad-hoc insight updates in an accurate and timely manner as required by the multiple stakeholders serviced by the team
Attend regular meetings with members of the wider business to identify and capture the insight requirements of digital marketing campaigns and deliver back insight
Provide recommendations on fan segments and target groups from data for LFC’s digital marketing campaigns. Issue marketing campaign wrap-ups reporting on key campaign results and ROAS, quantifying the impact of decisions we influence and providing clear recommendations for future campaigns
Who are we looking for?
To be successful you will have previous experience working within a digital marketing environment, including a relative degree level or equivalent. You’ll have experience working with multiple datasets, generating analysis to tight deadlines with stakeholders, with an eye for detail and experience turning data into insight/information, reports and visual presentations that can be presented and easily consumed by different stakeholders. You will have experience with database technologies with a good understanding of using the SQL language to query data as well as experience building digital dashboards, data visualisations, graphs and charts, preferably within Microsoft Power BI or Tableau. You will have a solid understanding of Google, SQL and other relevant analytic tools.
You’ll be able to demonstrate the ability to multi-task and work under pressure as well as being proactive and showing willingness to help others, when necessary, along with an ability to maintain good relationships with internal and external stakeholders and agencies. You will have strong organisational skills, attention to detail and excellent communication and writing skills. You’ll be a self-learner with a proactive attitude towards seeking to develop skills on new environments, platforms, and systems. You will have a strong understanding of digital analytics and Microsoft office tools, along with knowledge of main social networks and key digital marketing metrics.
Why should you apply?
This is a full-time permanent role working 35 hours per week Monday to Friday. Your main base will be our Head Office in Liverpool City Centre which is close to local bars, shops and restaurants and has great views over the river Mersey.
To reward your hard work and commitment we offer a competitive salary, 25 days holiday (plus 8 bank holidays and the option to purchase up to an additional 5 days) and a contributory pension scheme.
You will have access to our benefits kit bag where you can get high street discounts, and a selection of benefit schemes you can join. There are opportunities to get involved with volunteering through our LFC Foundation to give back to the local community.
We aspire to be the most inclusive club in world football - providing fair and appropriate opportunities to as many people from different backgrounds as possible, being welcoming and meeting their needs as best we can. We are committed to hiring great people representative of a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills, not just because it`s the right thing to do, but because we believe it makes our Club stronger. If you share our enthusiasm and passion for inclusivity, then we want to hear from you.
Liverpool FC is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and vulnerable adults and expects all Colleagues and Volunteers to share this commitment.

Data Scientist
At Freedom Finance we help customers navigate borrowing through our digital marketplace. At the heart of this, weve developed a modern technology finance platform built to connect customers with lenders via a seamless digital experience.
So, whats next for us? Well its our ambition is to keep extending our product range so we can provide customers with the widest choice, delivering value to customers, partners, and lenders. Were not just a B2C platform. We also offer embedded finance to our B2B partners, allowing them to broaden their current product offering and help more customers than ever before.
Were looking for an entrepreneurial Data Scientist to help us take our business one step further. The next phase of our evolution aims to use our vast amounts of data to develop new services that help customers save money and access the best available products. We are at the forefront of the Open Banking data evolution. Now, we need to someone who can help us accelerate our growth by using our data to enhance our capabilities.
What can we offer you?
Competitive salary with market benchmark
Bonus scheme based on personal and company performance
33 days holiday (includes bank holidays)
4% pension contribution & pension advice
Health cash plan (plus free balance for dependants up to the age of 16)
2 x Life Assurance
Enhanced Maternity/Adoption/Paternity Pay
Enhanced sick pay
Car Scheme (after 1 years service)
Income Protection
2 x days holiday buy/sell
Voucher/Tech scheme
Cycle-to-work scheme
Birthday takeaway voucher
Benefits portal with access to a wide range of retailer discounts
What will you be doing?
As a Data Scientist, you'll extract, analyse, and interpret large amounts of data from a range of sources, using algorithmic, data mining, artificial intelligence, machine learning and statistical tools to make it accessible. Once you've interpreted the data, you'll present your results using clear and engaging language.
Youll be working on the data products initiative, designing and building new products and services for our customer base. Youll be working towards two prime objectives:
Helping customers save money and improve their creditworthiness
Developing data-driven capabilities to automate our intelligence
Youll be joining a new capability within the business so you will have the opportunity to make a major impact.
Who we are looking for
You'll be expected to bridge a multi-disciplined domain of the business, data and software with a natural consultancy style to understand problems and devise solutions. Demonstrating exceptional communication and presentation skills to explain your work to people who don't understand the mechanics behind data analysis.
Youll have the drive and the resilience to try new ideas, and keep going in the face of adversity, so it's important that you're able to motivate yourself. As part of the interview process, well be interested in your experience across the following disciplines:
Probability and statistics
Multivariate calculus and linear algebra
Programming, packages and software such as R, Python and SQL
Data wrangling
Database management
Data visualisation
Machine learning / deep learning
The technology
Our platform is composed of leading modern software technologies deployed within the cloud. This was custom built from scratch and allows us to move fast with high quality and low risk. We strive for new and innovative ways to achieve outcomes, and youll have the opportunity to make use of technologies that can accelerate or differentiate our capabilities.
Our team
We like to create cross-functional teams working together on shared objectives. Youll be joining a newly formed capability composed of data scientists, BI developers, and data engineers, and together youll work with commercial, marketing and engineering teams to create innovative products and services.
Our main office is based in Manchester, but we have a flexible work-from-home policy and can consider fully remote positions for the right candidate. Its nice to catch up in person now and again so the ideal candidate should be open to this.
The interview process
We try to keep our interview process as simple and efficient as possible so that we can both make a timely decision about whether we align with each others interests and goals.
We have a fast and effective three-stage interview process. Stage one is a short phone screen, while stages two and three are both face-to-face interviews (using MS Teams or in-person). This allows candidates to meet with the hiring manager, and other team members.
We know that it can be challenging to interview while being employed, so we try to be flexible on interview times.
Interested? Then wed love to hear from you. If this sounds like the right career move, apply for our Data Scientist role using the apply now link.

We aim to provide an environment for creative minds from different backgrounds to thrive, bringing a wide range of skills and experiences to everything we do. As a purposeful, values-driven brand, we are committed to being a force for good in the world as well, creating the next generation of sustainable luxury for customers, driving industry change and championing our communities.
JOB PURPOSE

Putting the customer’s first is at the heart of what we do, and that includes the way we handle customer and data. Working within the Data Protection Office, the Data Privacy Advisor will be responsible for delivering innovative privacy programmes across Burberry’s global footprint. Based in the Data Protection Office in Leeds and reporting to the Data Privacy Manager, the Data Privacy Advisor will be central to responding to a dynamic privacy landscape and will rise to the challenge of working with key business areas in a fast-paced, highly creative environment.
RESPONSIBILITIES

As one of two Data Privacy Advisors operating in the team and reporting to the Data Privacy Manager. Between them, you will share the responsibilities below while working closely with other key stakeholders across the business. Each of the Data Privacy Advisors will be expected to specialise and lead some of these areas on their own, as well as supporting a varied and multi-disciplinary approach to data privacy:

Data Privacy Advisors are responsible for the following activities:

Records of Processing
o Understand and document how the business handles personal data across all different business areas, including HR, Customer Services, Marketing and Digital.
o Supporting Data Stewards across the business to ensure the Records of Processing is updated.
o Managing personal data risks and the remediation activity


Change Management
o Helping project managers to complete, Privacy Impact Assessments, and advising on privacy by design requirements.
o Review and oversight of data privacy compliance with new changes and vendors.
o Supporting specialist Privacy lawyers on change proposals.


Data Subject Requests
o Working with data champions to respond to requests in their business area.
o Develop templates and tools to improve the process and simplify our ways of working.
o Supporting specialist Privacy lawyers on complex requests.
o Proactive handling of data privacy issues and ensuring the right actions are delivered in a timely manner.
Training and Awareness
o Developing and delivering privacy-focussed online and face to face training and awareness to employees at all levels of the business.
o Work with business areas to understand their training needs.
o Develop engaging and innovative training materials and awareness campaigns.

Monitoring Compliance
o Monitor KPI’s and effectiveness measures and controls.
o Carry out effectiveness testing on data protection processes.
o Delivering privacy-focussed audit’s across business areas.

Operational Support
o Support the recording of incidents, requests, risk assessments.
o Prepare reports and metrics for managers.
o On-going administration of the programme and record keeping, to effectively track our data privacy workstreams
PERSONAL PROFILE

Required
A practical understanding of data protection law and practice, with at least some experience supporting a data protection programme.
Experience of working in a large organisation in the private sector
Experience of working with an audit methodology
Experience of working to a regulator/compliance standard


Desirable

Experience of working in a centralised team, delivering data protection tools, training, and projects across several teams.
A practical understanding of data protection law and practice, with at least some experience supporting a data protection programme.

Burberry is an Equal Opportunities Employer and as such, treats all applications equally and recruits purely on the basis of skills and experience.

We help people and wildlife adapt to climate change, work to reduce the impacts of flooding, drought, rising sea levels and coastal erosion. We improve the quality of our water, land and air by addressing pollution and work with businesses to help them comply with environmental regulations.

Do you have a passion for number crunching, statistics and modelling? Are you motivated by spotting patterns, identifying trends and understanding what the data is telling you? If so, we’re looking for a Data Analyst Level 4 Apprentice full of enthusiasm and potential to join us.

You’ll be completing a Data Analyst L4 Apprenticeship through a combination of online learning and remotely delivered workshops.

A minimum of 20% of your paid hours is allocated to apprenticeship training with the remainder of your time spent learning in the workplace.

You’ll be responsible for completing coursework on time, maintaining evidence for your assessments and putting into practice what you’re learning.
The team
As well as receive coaching and mentoring from professional team members, you will work with and learn from experienced Data Analysts

You'll be active in different types of work and involved in the delivery of various projects, all of which will enhance your knowledge and skills.

You will gain experience of Data Analysis., learn about various parts of our organisation, our great colleagues, obtain insight and knowledge to support your role and career.
Experience/skills required
You need to meet the apprenticeship eligibility criteria, detailed in the applicant Candidate Pack.

Experience is not as important as your enthusiasm and commitment, but you must be confident using numbers. The role is about being able to collate, interpret and analyse data. You will have access to both training and support to develop your abilities whilst in the role.

To lead the implementation of the Standard Bank Offshore Group’s Data Privacy Framework and as it relates to the holistic approach to Information Risk Management. Responsável pela supervisão das operações, de modo a garantir que todos os procedimentos são cumpridos de acordo as normas estabelecidas pela empresa, fazendo com que as operações corram como o esperado;
Receber veículo e dirigir o veículo sobre a linha de inspeção, conforme procedimento e instrução técnica em veículos leves e pesados, com gnv, veículos sinistrados e modificados e em veículos que transportam produto perigoso.
Realizar todas as etapas da inspeção, como pré-inspeção (calibragem de pneus, verificação de itens de segurança como portas, vidros, cintos e bancos), inspeção no fosso, da linha mecanizada, análise de gases, ruído e opacidade, conforme descrito no Manual de Procedimentos da empresa.
Realizar a limpeza e verificar a integridade da ‘quinta roda’ e ‘pino rei’ por meio de ensaio com líquido penetrante em inspeções de veículos que transportam produtos perigosos.
Realizar as devidas medições internas e externas, testes e verificações no processo de inspeção do CIPP (Certificado de Inspeção de Produtos Perigosos).
Realizar teste de estanqueidade em veículos com GNV, quando este serviço estiver no escopo da unidade.
Na ausência do Engenheiro Mecânico, irá substitui-lo;
Pré-requisitos:
Ensino Superior em Engenheira Mecânica;
Conhecimento Técnico – Em normas e Legislação de trânsito;
Conhecimento em Mecânica de Veículos;
Conhecimento de normas de segurança;
Pacote Office avançado, possuir CNH D.
Tipo de vaga: Tempo integral, Efetivo CLT

Assistência médica

Vale-transporte

Turno de 8 horas
Escolaridade:
Ensino Técnico completo (Obrigatório)

Data de início prevista: 22/08/2022

obre o Grupo 3corações
O Grupo 3corações é construído por pessoas, antes de tudo, apaixonadas pelo que fazem. Temos orgulho de crescer pela força do trabalho e seguir, cada vez mais longe, sem esquecer a nossa essência e os nossos valores.
É pelo nosso jeito simples de ser que celebramos a diversidade de pessoas e as experiências saborosas que entrelaçam histórias.
O resultado é uma companhia com produtos de qualidade, colaboradores e consumidores felizes, fornecedores e parceiros integrados em uma mesma missão: proporcionar experiências prazerosas que promovam alegria e bem-estar, criando laços duradouros e gerando valor para todos.
Deguste um mundo de possibilidades na maior empresa de café do Brasil!

Saiba mais em www.3coracoes.com.br

ATIVIDADES

Realizar contagens de mercadorias e produtos;
Verificar datas de validade dos produtos;
Auditar o retorno físico dos produtos;
Dar suporte na organização do inventário.

Ensino médio completo;

BENEFÍCIOS
Plano de Saúde compartilhado
Plano Odontológico
Ticket alimentação
Kit de Produtos Mensal;

Assessoramos empresa do segmento de energia na busca de LÍDER DE IMPLANTAÇÃO DE AUTOMAÇÃO com formação em Engenharia Elétrico ou Automação. Profissional irá analisar e aprovar os projetos e especificações técnicas dos serviços e materiais a serem utilizados em sistemas de automação de subestações, gerenciar os contratos das empresas terceirizadas para execução das atividades, inspecionar as obras em campo e garantir a conformidade do projeto, o atendimento aos prazos de execução e a maximização da qualidade dentro dos custos previstos do empreendimento. Necessário: Conhecimento técnico em automação e gestão de subestações, condução de gerenciamento de processos; Conhecimento em ferramentas de gestão de qualidade; Sistema SAP; Inglês Intermediário; Excel Intermediário; CNH B e Disponibilidade para viagens.

O Grupo 3corações é constituído por pessoas, antes de tudo, apaixonadas pelo o que fazem. Temos orgulho de crescer pela força do trabalho e seguir, cada vez mais longe, sem esquecer a nossa essência e os nossos valores.
É pelo jeito simples de ser que celebramos a diversidade de pessoas e experiências saborosas que entrelaçam histórias.
O resultado é uma companhia com produtos de qualidade, colaboradores e consumidores felizes, fornecedores e parceiros integrados em uma mesma missão: proporcionar experiências prazerosas que promovam alegria e bem-estar, criando laços duradouros e gerando valor para todos.
Deguste um mundo de possibilidades na maior empresa de café do Brasil.
ATIVIDADES
Realizar contagens de mercadorias e produtos;
Realizar separação de produtos;
Carga e descarga de produtos;
Verificar datas de validade dos produtos, bem como o retorno físico;
Prestar suporte à organização do inventário, realizando a movimentação dos produtos.
REQUISITOS NECESSÁRIOS
Experiência em áreas operacionais;
Ensino Médio Completo.
Horário de Trabalho:
Disponibilidade para trabalhar no 1º, 2º e 3º turno.
Nível da vaga: Auxiliar

O Grupo Darnel está presente em mais de 100 países do mundo. Somos uma empresa líder com presença global, que oferece soluções embalagens 100% recicláveis e materiais de construção.
No Brasil, nossa maior força são nossos 500 colaboradores que atuam em equipe a serviço dos clientes. Com orgulho, somos considerados uma das melhores empresas para se trabalhar, segundo o GPTW.
Temos a mente aberta e trabalhamos com diferentes perspectivas para desconstruir crenças e obter resultados rapidamente. Isso faz com que superemos obstáculos sem medir esforços. Estamos em constante transformação, desenvolvendo novas tecnologias e materiais para que o nosso cliente tenha a melhor experiência Darnel todos os dias.
Como colaborador da Darnel, você trabalhará em um ambiente dinâmico que promove crescimento por meio de aprendizagem e desenvolvimento, reconhece e recompensa seu empenho, proporciona um trabalho com significado e dá a você a oportunidade de gerar impacto na vida das pessoas em todo o mundo. Afinal, somos movidos por um único propósito que é fazer parte do dia a dia de todos.
O que buscamos para essa posição
Atividades:
Realizar prospecção, abertura e manutenção de novos clientes;
Responsável pela criação e planejamento de rotas diárias, semanais e mensais dos clientes;
Responsável pela apresentação e fechamento de propostas comerciais;
Acompanhamento de cotações;
Coordenar e realizar plano de compras;
Realizar monitoramento de indicadores comerciais (Venda e positivação);
Realizar desenvolvimento, implantação e execução de estratégias de vendas.
Requisitos:
Ensino médio completo ou superior cursando;
Conhecimento pacote office básico;
Vivência na área de vendas externas;
Possuir CNH;
Disponibilidade para atuação em João Pessoa e Campina Grande/PB;
Conhecimento na área de embalagens é considerado um diferencial.

fullJobDescribtion:
#VemserAssaí, vem fazer a diferença com a gente!

Crescer é a nossa estratégia! Por isso, buscamos profissionais iguais a nós, que tenham muita vontade de se desenvolver em um ambiente dinâmico e que oferece muitas oportunidades.

Valorizamos e destacamos profissionais que tenham:
Empatia
Relacionamento Interpessoal
Foco no cliente
Comprometimento
Organização
Excelência no Atendimento

Responsabilidades e atribuições

Temos oportunidades para:
Repositor de Mercadorias
Responsável por manter as gôndolas abastecidas e limpas, assegurando que as mercadorias estejam precificadas, organizadas e seguras.
Podendo atuar nas áreas: Mercearia, Açougue, Hortifruti, Laticínios, Frios, Embutidos, Congelados, Seca Doce, Seca Salgada, Bebidas, Bazar e Depósito.

Repositor Pleno de Mercadorias
Responsável por verificação e atuação nas datas de validade e quebras, recebimento, organização e precificação das mercadorias no setor e nas câmaras resfriadas e congeladas. Atuação nas auditorias para acompanhamento de indicadores do setor e inventário.

Experiência anterior em comércio varejista ou atacadista e experiência com controle de validade, quebras, manuseio de sistema, precificação.

Requisitos e qualificações

Escolaridade: Ensino Médio Completo
Faixa etária: Mínimo 18 anos

Informações adicionais

Alguns de nossos benefícios:
Assistência Médica ou Auxílio Saúde
Assistência Odontológica (opcional)
Vale transporte
Cesta Básica
Cartão Mamãe
Enxoval do bebê
Convênio com academias
Refeição no local
Seguro de vida

HEY, VOCÊ!

Muito prazer: somos o Assaí Atacadista, a empresa de atacado de autosserviço com mais de 47 anos de tradição e uma das Marcas Mais Valiosas do Brasil, segundo o ranking 2021 da Interbrand.

Hoje, temos mais de 200 lojas, com mais de 60 mil colaboradores(as) que atuam com M-U-I-T-A paixão por atender nossos(as) clientes, desde pequenos e médios comerciantes e transformadores(as), até consumidores(as) finais que buscam por variedade e economia, cumprindo a nossa missão de abastecer os lares de milhares de brasileiros com alimentos e itens básicos.

Somos uma empresa que cuida da Nossa Gente, zela pela simplicidade e acredita no poder da diversidade e inclusão – atitudes que fazem parte dos valores da Nossa Cultura ‘Ser Assaí é Assim’ e, mais do que isso, são vivenciadas e praticadas no dia a dia em todas as nossas lojas, CDs e escritórios.

E com o nosso processo de expansão em ritmo acelerado, estamos crescendo e trazendo cada vez mais pessoas para fazerem parte do nosso time. Afinal, o crescimento do nosso negócio significa o crescimento da Nossa Gente. Por isso, buscamos profissionais que tenham muita vontade de se desenvolver em um ambiente inclusivo, que respeita todos e todas, jeitos, raças, cores e crenças, além de muito dinâmico, repleto de desafios e oportunidades!

As vagas publicadas nesta página são específicas para a nova loja Epitácio Pessoa, que será inaugurada em breve.

Toda nossa operação está atendendo todos os decretos emitidos pelas entidades governamentais e seguindo processos rigorosos de limpeza, higiene e desinfecção. São diversas ações de prevenção e combate ao coronavírus para garantir a segurança de todos(as): colaboradores(as), clientes, parceiros(as) e também de candidatos(as). Por isso, todo o processo seletivo será ajustado para minimizar os riscos para todos os envolvidos, podendo ser realizado com etapas online e presencial, seguindo as fases abaixo:

Cadastro do candidato
Testes
Entrevista com RH do Assaí
Entrevista com Gestor
Preenchimento de dados de pré-contratação
Contratação - Assinatura do Contrato de Trabalho

#VemserAssaí e faça a diferença com a gente!

fullJobDescribtion:
MINSAIT

Estamos presentes em mais de 140 países, desenvolvendo projetos inovadores e fornecendo soluções tecnológicas que impactam positivamente os negócios, a sociedade e o planeta.
Há mais 25 anos no Brasil, somos reconhecidos por oferecer um ambiente estimulante, aprendizado contínuo, oportunidades de crescimento e mobilidade nacional e internacional para nossos talentos.
Nossos mais de 9.000 profissionais espalhados de norte a sul do país, atestam nossa cultura de respeito, diversidades e inclusiva.
Por meio da nossa empresa de transformação digital e tecnologia da informação, a Minsait, atuamos nas operações críticas dos nossos clientes, aportando tecnologias disruptivas e serviços especializados.

Junte-se à nós!

Responsabilidades e atribuições

Atuação em Arquitetura de integração de dados.

Requisitos e qualificações

Desejável formação e/ou pós na Área de Exatas ou Estatística e no mínimo 4 anos de experiência com extração, transformação e ingestão de dados.

Atribuições
Entender contexto de uso da informação.
Refinar regras de negócio para construção de variáveis.
Propor variáveis para uso em modelos analíticos.
Modelagem de dados.
Implementar, publicar e disponibilizar modelos analíticos em produção.

Habilidades
Essenciais
Conhecimento de versionamento de código Git e CI/CD.
Big data - ecossistema hadoop, hive, spark (PySpark).
Conhecimento de data warehouse e data lake.
Experiência com esteiras tradicionais (SQL).
Bancos Relacionais, NoSQL e NewSQL.
Modelagem de dados.
Conhecimento do processo de extração, transformação e carregamento de dados (ETL).

Desejáveis
Big data – ecossistema hadoop, Scala, hbase, kafka.
Conhecimento do ciclo de vida das informações, indicadores de qualidade e governança.
Conhecimento de ambientes de nuvem (AWS, GCP, Azure). Conhecer pelo menos um tipo dessas 3.
Realização de deploy em ferramentas de nuvem.
Construção de dashboards a partir de fluxos de dados.
Evidenciação e mensuração de resultados obtidos através da implantação de soluções analíticas.
Aspectos Comportamentais
Facilidade em interpretar problemas de negócio
Experiência em equipes ágeis

EXPERIÊNCIAS DESEJÁVEIS:
Vivência no comercial de alto volume e entrega; Experiencia em gestão de time de vendedores; Atuação em cargo de liderança em empresas de grande porte no ramo de serviços.

ATRIBUIÇÕES:
O coordenador de vendas Trainee irá dar apoio ao coordenador regional no desenvolvimento e capacitação da equipe de lojas, contratação de novos Gestores de Negócios, referente ao produto consórcio, acompanhamento de indicadores, distrato, e impulsionamento da marca.

Apoio na coordenação da equipe regional de Lojas e Representantes no segmento de Consórcio, considerando resultados e comportamentos de cada mercado, respeitando cultura e sazonalidade.
Apoio na contratação, treinamento e acompanhamento dos Representantes.
Promover ações de vendas no objetivo de potencializar as vendas de Consórcio.
Aumentar o market share da empresa.
Apoio na gestão de acompanhamento dos resultados promovendo análises do desempenho individual e por regional para direcionamento de foco das ações.
Pesquisar as ações das concorrências locais para identificar suas estratégias visando desenvolver ações para estabelecer competitividade.
Garantir a motivação da equipe através de reuniões de equipe para valorizar resultados e desempenhos individuais e fortalecimento de práticas de vendas de Consórcio.
Auxilio na negociação de vendas da equipe.

Coordenador

3 anos

JobTitle: Analista de Infraestrutura de TI Sênior
fullJobDescribtion: Monitorar e controlar a replicação dos workloads produtivos do DC Principal para a Contingência; Interagir com os times de Telecom buscando tratar das questões referentes a disponibilidade, qualidade throughput, latência e demais características dos links de comunicação que interligam ambos os DC; Acompanhar indicadores referente à disponibilidade do ambiente de Contingência, no que tange às estruturas de Servidores Virtuais - VMware, Servidores Físicos, BDs Oracle e SQL; Garantir que as atualizações realizadas no DC Principal sejam refletidas no DC de contingência através de procedimentos, controles internos e processos bem definidos e acordados com a Gerência de Infraestrutura; Garantir que todos os ativos constantes no DC de Contingência estejam suportados por suporte e garantia (manutenção preventiva, preditiva e corretiva), respondendo ao desempenho esperado etc.; Gerenciar os contratos de fornecedores de hardware, software e demais parceiros que suportam a infraestrutura do DC. Conhecimento das ferramentas de replicação: RP4VM, Carbonite, Data Guard, AlwaysOn. Conhecimento em Gerenciamento de Projetos; ITIL e COBIT; Sistemas de Gestão integrados; Sistemas Operacionais; Microsoft; Linux; Servidores; Storages; Hiperconvergência; Gerenciamento de Processos TI e Governança. Inglês Intermediário Ensino Superior Completo Certificações: Microsoft Windows Server LPIC-01 e LPIC-02 Azzure Storages

JobTitle: Vendedor de Consórcio (022) - João Pessoa I - PB
fullJobDescribtion:
Você é ousado, criativo e não tem medo de desafios? A Embracon quer te conhecer!

Buscamos pessoas inquietas, que confiam em seu potencial e compartilham da mesma paixão que todos nós: transformar a vida de nossos clientes.

Trabalhando conosco, você terá todo o suporte para se desenvolver, encontrará líderes prontos para te ouvir e te ajudar e participará de programas de reconhecimento. Tudo para você se sentir sempre motivado e contribuir cada vez mais com o sucesso da nossa empresa.

Se você se encaixa nessa descrição, esta oportunidade é para você!

Responsabilidades e atribuições

Realizar prospecção e divulgação do produto, fechamento de novas vendas, cuidando da carteira de clientes, respeitando as politicas da organização de forma sustentável preservando sempre relacionamentos benéficos com o olhar para a missão de "Gerar Encantamento".

Realizar venda de consorcio respeitando regras e padronização estabelecidas pela empresa
Realizar visita aos clientes

Realizar atendimento a clientes para esclarecimento de dúvidas

Entrar em contato com o cliente antes da data do vencimento de sua parcela
Realizar contato com clientes inadimplentes
Preenchimento de contrato de forma correta
Responsável pela venda, qualidade e satisfação do cliente
Participar de treinamentos quando convocado
Manter-se atualizado sobre o produto.

Programas de reconhecimento
Programa de qualidade de vida
UCE (Universidade Corporativa Embracon)

Somos a Embracon

Há mais de 30 anos, atuamos no mercado de consórcio, trazendo as melhores soluções para que as pessoas possam realizar seus sonhos, sejam eles quais forem. Para isso, nos baseamos naquilo que mais acreditamos: nossos valores.

Ser Simples, Inovar Sempre, Construir Juntos e Ser Íntegro são a fórmula do nosso sucesso. Afinal, é por meio desses valores que garantimos a parceria com nossos mais de 175 mil clientes ativos e também que mantemos nossos 3 mil colaboradores e mais de 800 parceiros de vendas engajados ao nosso propósito.

Se hoje somos considerados uma das maiores administradoras de consórcio do país (segundo o ranking do Branco Central) e avaliados, há mais de 10 anos (pelo GPTW), como umas das melhores empresas do Brasil para trabalhar, é porque contamos com um time que confia naquilo que fazemos e transforma os sonhos de nossos clientes em seus próprios objetivos.

MISSÃO
Gerar encantamento.

VISÃO
Ser a maior, melhor e mais confiável administradora de consórcio do país.

VALORES
Ser Simples – Acreditamos no poder da simplicidade. Ela conecta e transforma desafios em oportunidades, impulsionando o crescimento do jeito que queremos: sempre juntos!

Ser Íntegro – Integridade e respeito são nossa base. São eles que sustentam a relação de confiança, ética e transparência que cultivamos com todas as pessoas.

Inovar Sempre – Inovar é atitude de protagonista. É provocar novas formas de fazer, independentemente de sua área.

Construir Juntos – Fazer juntos é o melhor jeito para evoluir! É quebrar qualquer tipo de barreira e cultivar a cooperação e o genuíno espírito de equipe.

PROPÓSITO
Realizar sonhos

Pronto para fazer parte?
A Embracon é uma empresa que trabalha com foco nos resultados. Isso significa que esperamos que nossos colaboradores deem sempre o seu melhor.

Aqui, cada um tem a oportunidade de trilhar a sua própria carreira, se desenvolver, trazer novas ideias e soluções. Para isso, oferecemos um ambiente de trabalho onde prevalece o cuidado, a proximidade, o acolhimento, a confiança e as relações genuínas.

Se você se identifica com essa descrição e acredita que pode contribuir com o crescimento da Embracon, confira abaixo todas as vagas disponíveis!

#OrgulhodeSerEmbracon #oclimaeagentequefaz

Indústria Alimentícia admite Analista de Trade Marketing em Igarassu para atuar em Tempo integral, Comercial.

Elaborar calendário de ações, monitorar através do aplicativo a time em campo, verificar as tarefas da equipe, estudar o comportamento do shopper e ajudar o coordenador de trade a implantar ferramentas para mensuração dos indicadores. É oferecido contrato Efetivo, Beneficios a combinar /
vaga cód: 902261515

Principais atividades:
1- Desenvolver processos de melhoria contínua nos produtos, conforme descrições técnicas.
2- Criar e controlar a lista técnica de peças (BOM’s), por meio de análises do modelo 3D, a fim de facilitar a visualização dos materiais que compõe o produto
3- Promover o suporte técnico do produto aos clientes internos e externos.
4- Realizar a manutenção e organização do arquivo técnico do produto.
5- Orientar quanto à sequência de montagem do produto;
6- Sugerir, implantar e monitorar processos operacionais que cujo objetivo é a redução de custo na fábrica (protótipos, corrida piloto, engineering analysis, 8D)
7- Confeccionar protótipos através de orientações e especificações;
8- Controlar as requisições de compras da área.
9- Manter interface com as demais plantas.
10- Atuar nos processos de auditoria da área.

SOBRE NÓS :
Nossa história iniciou em 2019 com a união dos grupos mineiros SFA e Super Cidades, escolhendo o Nordeste para ser cenário de uma de nova loja, focada em entregar às famílias mais qualidade e diversidade de produtos, com baixo custo e fácil acesso.
O objetivo principal do Novo Atacarejo é trazer qualidade de vida para seus colaboradores e clientes, com o atendimento diferenciado e preços competitivos. Temos orgulho de fazer parte dessa família, por isso que Somos Novo!
Venha fazer parte da nossa família!
ENCARREGADO DE PADARIA
Coordenar a equipe de trabalho do setor de padaria e confeitaria, direcionando
atividades aos colaboradores, como: compra de ingredientes, higienização e limpeza,
preparo de alimentos, assamento, resfriamento, embalagem, pesagem, exposição, e
atendimento ao cliente, seguindo as normas e procedimentos estabelecidos pelo Gerente
da loja, Supervisor Técnico;
Verificar as condições dos balcões antes da abertura da loja, observando o mix de
produtos expostos, a qualidade e a data de validade dos produtos, retirando e lançando
nas perdas sempre que necessário;
Controlar a jornada de trabalho dos colaboradores do setor controlando o banco de horas ,organizando a escala de
folgas, férias, e dias a serem trabalhados, bem como, verificando a uniformização e
utilização correta dos EPI's;
Retirar no depósito os ingredientes para a produção de alimentos no setor,
acompanhando e controlando o valor dos produtos, direcionando-os ao responsável de
Prevenção e Perdas para a transferência ao setor de panificadora e confeitaria;
Controlar a produção de diferentes categorias de pães e confeitos, conforme os
ingredientes, receituários, mix de produtos da loja;
Direcionar os pães, tortas e doces para assar no forno de acordo com o tempo e a
temperatura de cada categoria de produto;
Direcionar os diferentes tipos de pães e salgados assados à exposição no balcão de
vendas da panificação e confeitaria, prezando pelo bom aspecto visual e a atratividade
aos olhos dos clientes;
Atender solicitações de clientes quando requisitado, sempre com educação, respeito e
simpatia, considerando dúvidas e pedidos de produtos frente ao balcão de atendimento;
Organizar o setor para o fechamento da loja, efetuando a higienização do setor,
retirada de descartes, acondicionando os produtos corretamente, bem como, desligando
as balanças e maquinários, deixando o setor devidamente limpo e organizado para o
turno seguinte;
Acompanhar novas receitas e diferentes modelagens na linha de produção de
acordo com os critérios estabelecidos pelo Supervisor técnicos;
Efetuar a contagem de balancetes mensais e balanços trimestrais, levantando a
quantidade de produtos;
Limpar e organizar o setor de trabalho, respeitando os padrões da empresa e da
vigilância sanitária.
O QUE PRECISAMOS:
Ensino médio completo;
Experiência mínima de dois anos em panificação.

Você será um imã de informação e um catalisador de soluções inovadoras. Seu papel será garantir o sucesso dos nossos clientes acompanhando tudo que acontece na conta do início a entrega de resultados. Principais atividades: Fazer a gestão de uma carteira de clientes mantendo (no máximo 3), mantendo canais de comunicação abertos e ativos, realizando relacionamento constante; Cuidar do onboarding de novos clientes de sua carteira; Implantar nossa metodologia de trabalho na rotina do cliente; Garantir a implementação de tudo o que foi planejado e vendido; Garantir que as expectativas do cliente serão atendidas e assegurar os interesses da agência; Acompanhar, colher, monitorar e analisar informações de resultados do clientes e KPIs de customer analytics Canopus; Presidir reuniões com cliente, kick offs e alinhamentos interno; Fazer gestão de projetos/jobs: controlando e documentado step by step, com briefing e cronogramas, garantindo que prazos e acordos sejam cumpridos; Através de data driven e relacionamento, identificar/antecipar oportunidades, rupturas e necessidades (do cliente ou da agência).
Requisitos Superior completo em Publicidade e Propaganda, Comunicação Social ou correlatas; Conhecimentos/Experiência em Marketing Digital, Trade Marketing, Outbound Marketing e Live Marketing; Experiências anteriores em CS, atendimento de contas e/ou gestão de projetos; Conhecimentos/Experiência em gestão de projetos; Ser super organizado e responsável (conhecer princípios do Accountability); Ser um comunicador nato, independente do meio usado, com boa desenvoltura por e-mail, telefone, reuniões etc.; Ter senso analítico e de urgência afiado; Ser obcecado por desafios e superá-los, focado em atingir/ultrapassar metas; Ser resiliente, empático e possuir inteligência emocional para lidar com situações de pressão e crise; Perfil ágil, criativo, proativo, colaborativo, curioso, inovador, com muita vontade de aprender e ser a melhor versão de si mesmo dia após dia.
Desejável Conhecimentos em Customer Analytics e áreas ligadas a Data Driven; Conhecimento em técnicas básicas de persuasão (PNL).
Benefícios Bônus anual; Descanso anual; Programa de subvenção de cursos – para você estar em constante aprendizado e desenvolvimento; Day off no mês do aniversário; Trabalho remoto; Auxílio home office mensal no cartão Swile – para você utilizar como desejar; Zenklub – para você cuidar da sua saúde mental; Totalpass – para você cuidar da sua saúde física; New Value – clube de descontos para te ajudar com sua saúde financeira; Aulas quinzenais de Mindfulness – meditação guiada; Coworkings parceiros em SP e ABC. Pensando em carreira? Nós temos ciclo de avaliação de desempenho semestral, rotina de feedbacks, plano de desenvolvimento, reuniões 1:1 periódicas e mais!
Outras Informações Nosso propósito: Fidelizar clientes, evoluir marcas, impactar pessoas, gerar negócios e atingir o sucesso dos nossos clientes com resultados mais que esperados. Nossa cultura: Trabalhamos orientados pelos nossos oito valores de cultura organizacional: Customer Center; Data Driven; Accountability; Freak por Inovação; Transcendence; Simple Way; Brotherhood; Diversidade. Ferramentas: Utilizamos ferramentas que são nossas aliadas no modelo remote first, como: Google Workspace (Calendar, Meet, Gmail e muito mais), Slack, Feedz e Runrun.it.
